page.title: 01Caythorpe & Fulbeck
page.content: Two villages built on the escarpment known as "The Cliff" the majority of workers commute to Grantham, Lincoln or RAF college Cranwell and some as far as London. The is some local work at Caythorpe Agricultural College, Kesteven Castings Ltd, Local Agricultural and Service Industries. The college has students from all over G.B. and overseas studying animal husbandry and arable farming. On courses varying from day release to 3 year residential. Soil varies from heavy wet clay in "The Lowfields" to dry heath on top of "The Cliff". On private farms the crops are the usual cereals/sugarbeet, potatoes, oilseed rape, and there is some cattle and sheep rearing in the "The Lowfields" west of the cliff.
